value.title: GIC, Mubadala Said Poised to Join KKR’s $10 Billion STT Deal
value.content: GIC Pte and Mubadala Investment Co. are in talks to join KKR & Co. and Singapore Telecommunications Ltd. in their potential purchase of data center operator STT GDC Pte, people familiar with the matter said, in what could be one of the biggest digital infrastructure deals in recent months.

value.title: Oracle to Raise Up to $50 Billion in 2026 for Cloud Buildup
value.content: Oracle Corp. plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year through a combination of debt and equity sales to build additional cloud infrastructure capacity, reflecting the scale of financing needed to feed AI’s growth.

value.title: Nomura Shares Drop After Profit Falls More Than Estimated
value.content: Nomura Holdings Inc. shares fell after profit dropped more than analysts anticipated last quarter, due to a loss in Europe and one-time costs tied to a major acquisition.

value.title: Lasertec Shares Drop After Outlook Misses Market Expectations
value.content: Lasertec Corp.’s stock price plunged 10% after the company raised its outlook less than investors had anticipated in the face of an AI-related surge in spending.

value.title: Warner Bros. Acquisition Puts Netflix in Regulators’ Crosshairs
value.content: Netflix has long excelled at avoiding regulatory entanglements. That’s about to change.

value.title: China AI Deals Push Hong Kong Listings to Busiest Start of the Year
value.content: It has never been this busy at the start of a year for new listings in Hong Kong.

value.title: Abu Dhabi Royal Invested in Trump Crypto Venture, WSJ Says
value.content: An Abu Dhabi royal signed a secret deal with the Trump family to buy a stake in their cryptocurrency venture, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing company documents and people familiar with the matter.

value.title: Waymo Seeking About $16 Billion Near $110 Billion Valuation
value.content: Waymo, Alphabet Inc.’s autonomous driving unit, is aiming to raise about $16 billion in a financing round that would value the unit at nearly $110 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

value.title: Rolls-Royce Moon Nuclear Reactor Plan Stalls, Telegraph Says
value.content: British engine maker Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc has halted a plan backed by millions in government funding to put a mini nuclear reactor on the Moon, the Telegraph reported.

value.title: Pledge to Invest $100 Billion in OpenAI Was ‘Never a Commitment,’ Says Nvidia's Huang
value.content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said the company’s proposed $100 billion investment in OpenAI was “never a commitment” and that the company would consider any funding rounds “one at a time.”

value.title: Apple’s Historic Quarter Doesn’t Change the Need for AI Reckoning
value.content: Apple’s blockbuster holiday quarter was impressive — but it shouldn’t give cover to avoid an AI reckoning. Also: A new MacBook Pro is planned for the macOS 26.3 release cycle; the company explores a clamshell follow-up to its upcoming foldable phone; and an updated AirTag finally rolls out.

value.title: Indian Electronics Manufacturing Shares Rise on Budget Boost
value.content: Shares of some Indian electronics manufacturing services companies ended higher in Sunday trading after the finance minister set aside 400 billion rupees ($4.3 billion) to boost the sector and position the country as a global hub for the sector.

value.title: Capgemini to Divest US Unit Criticized for Contracts With ICE
value.content: French IT services provider Capgemini SE plans to sell a US-based unit that’s facing scrutiny over its contracts with US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).

value.title: India Unveils 20-Year Tax Break to Woo Global Data Centers
value.content: India will offer a two-decade tax holiday to overseas firms that provide global data center services from the country, stepping up efforts to woo investors in its fast-growing digital infrastructure sector.

value.title: Indonesia Permits Elon Musk’s Grok to Resume Service After Ban
value.content: Indonesia has permitted the artificial intelligence tool Grok to resume service after Elon Musk’s X provided assurances to the government following its ban for producing sexualized content.

value.title: Nvidia CEO Says New OpenAI Investment May Be Largest Yet
value.content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said the company will be participating in OpenAI’s latest funding round, describing it as potentially “the largest investment we’ve ever made.”

value.title: Former Microsoft Windows Boss Sought Epstein Advice on Career
value.content: Former senior Microsoft Corp. executive Steven Sinofsky sought Jeffrey Epstein’s advice as he negotiated the terms of his exit from the company and worked through what to do next, according to documents made public by the Justice Department.

value.title: AI Boom Is Triggering a Loan Meltdown for Software Companies: Credit Weekly
value.content: Amid broad euphoria in credit markets, one type of debt is facing growing fear.

value.title: Nvidia CEO Supports All Developers Amid DeepSeek Claims
value.content: Nvidia Corp. supports “every developer” that uses its software, Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said, after a US lawmaker accused the chip giant of offering technical support that helped China’s DeepSeek improve its artificial intelligence model. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Jensen Huang Speaks on OpenAI Financing
value.content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang spoke to press in Taipei, Taiwan on OpenAI financing saying "we'll definitely participate in the next round of financing because it's such a good investment." (Source: Bloomberg)
